doc:
Werner Klemperer https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Werner_Klemperer 0 Werner Klemperer (March 22, 1920 – December 6, 2000) was a German-American stage, film, and television actor and singer/musician. Born in Cologne, Rhine Province, Germany, Klemperer and his family fled Germany in 1935. After serving in the United States Army during World War II, he began his professional acting career on the Broadway stage in 1947. Klemperer appeared in several films and numerous guest starring roles during the 1950s and 1960s. In 1965, he won the role of Colonel Wilhelm Klink on the CBS television sitcom Hogan's Heroes. The series aired for six seasons with Klemperer receiving a Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Comedy Series nomination for each year, winning the award in 1968 and 1969. Werner_Klemperer ( March_22_,_1920 – December_6_,_2000 ) was a_German-American_stage , film , and television_actor_and_singer/musician . Born in Cologne , Rhine_Province , Germany , Klemperer and his_family fled Germany in 1935 . After serving in the_United_States_Army during World_War_II , he began his_professional_acting_career on the_Broadway_stage in 1947 . Klemperer appeared in several_films and numerous_guest starring roles during the_1950s_and_1960s . In 1965 , he won the_role of Colonel_Wilhelm_Klink on the_CBS_television_sitcom_Hogan 's_Heroes . The_series aired for six_seasons with Klemperer receiving a_Primetime_Emmy_Award for Outstanding_Supporting_Actor in a_Comedy_Series_nomination for each_year , winning the_award in 1968_and_1969 .
